results.title: Time for caring: a school's response to the sexually abused child
results.creator_credit: Richard Baker, Sandra Baker and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Raises issues for teachers concerning child abuse: 1. Teachers need to be aware that child sexual abuse is a very real community problem. - 2. Teachers have a responsibility to children in their care to be aware of the behavioural indicators of child sexual abuse. - 3. The need for teachers to report suspected sexual abuse cases to the relevant authorities. Social workers and psychologists present the indicators of child sexual abuse and how to proceed (US) if one suspects child sexual abuse.

results.title: Watching them write, seeing them learn: a kindergarten writing community at work
results.creator_credit: Brian Butler and Riverina College of Advanced Education. Literacy Centre
results.brief_description: Kindergarten children experiment with written language. There are no formal writing lessons and they are left free to learn by trial and error. Narrated by Barbara Kamler.

results.title: Mechanical energy
results.brief_description: Describes how mechanical energy exerts a force in solid, liquid and gas states and how we use these forces to do work. Explains potential and kinetic energy and how machines provide mechanical advantage.

results.title: Times are changing
results.creator_credit: Mitch Matthews, Ben Cardillo and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A contemporary Australian story which considers the effects of unemployment on family life. George loses his job after 35 years of employment and not knowing how to tell his wife and family, pretends to go to work each day. Ideal for considering the value of work and study, the importance attached to work as viewed by different generations, family relationships, traditional sex roles, technological change and communication. Lead role played by Max Cullen.

results.title: Preventative action
results.creator_credit: John Honey, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Australian marathon runner Robert de Castella talks of his preventative medicine approach to lifestyle. Expectations of cure are very high in society but generally the public doesn’t want to actively participate in prevention. Poses the question: “Who is responsible for providing preventative health care services?”

results.title: Portland: Victoria's first settlement
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the development in the Portland region since the early nineteeth century when some two hundred sealers were working Bass Strait. Todays Portland’s deep harbour is used by ships from more than fifty countries as well as deep sea trawlers that land tonnes of fish. Portland’s latest primary industry looks to be an aluminium smelter being built at a cost of eleven hundred million dollars.

results.title: Perfect diet
results.brief_description: Jo Pearson of the Channel 10 Eyewitness News presents a special five-part news feature on diet. Episode 1. Examines the basics of the Australian Nutrition Foundation’s Perfect Diet Pyramid. Episode 2. Highlights the dietary problems of teenagers and children and analyses the Beverly Hills diet. Episode 3. Looks at how fat assessment is carried out and the myth of cellulite. Provides an analysis of Dr. Atkins diet. Episode 4. Shows the characteristics of diets that make people fat and analyses the F-Plan diet. Episode 5. Examines the myths of dieting: e.g. honey is better than sugar, bread and potatoes are fattening and analyses the Scarsdale diet. No other credits available.

results.title: Pete's pigs: a journey through an intensive piggery
results.brief_description: Provides comparison between a mechanized piggery and the traditional method of running a piggery, noting the vast improvements in the control of disease and breeding that have come with automation. No other credits.
